Description: Fragment of rim of pottery rosette bowl. Medium-fine, yellowish brown (10 YR 6/4) clay with a little silver mica. Matt black paint. Exterior: top of lip painted; below, rosette of six petals. Interior: painted; white-red-white horizontal stripes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Kerschner Group I; Piekarski 2001 / p.19 no. A 2 pl.1.2
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 19, no. A2, pl. 1, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.816)
